result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian L. Loveland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
14CM586, 15CF5, 15CF159, 15CF240 & 15CF248: Defendant Brian L. Loveland in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. victim rights complied with, one victim is present; discussion on status of each case; State heard; on 15CF159 Court conducts waiver of PH on record, Def. F&V waives, Arraignment conducted; in 15CF240 & 248, waiver of PH previously filed on 7/14/15, Arraignment conducted; Court reviews charges/penalties of charges pleading to; Def. pleads NC to DC in Counts 1 and 2 in Amended Compliant in 14CM586, Def. pleads NC to Count 1 Poss/Illegally Obtained Prescription in Amended Information in 15CF5, Def. pleads NG to Count 1 Obtaining Controlled Substance by Fraud in Information in 15CF240 and Def. pleads NC to Count 2 Knowlingly Violate DA Injunction in Information in 15CF248; parties stip. to facts; 2 days credit in 14CM586 and 37 days credit in probation cases; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of 2 counts of DC in 14CM586, Count 1 of 15CF5 Poss./Illegally Obtained Presc., Count 1 of 15CF240 Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, Count 2 of 14CF248 Knowingly Violate DA Injunction; Case 15CF159 is D&RI and all other charges are D&RI; Court now calls 14CV386, discussion held, Court will dismiss same; Atty. Moeller to draft and submit something on that; State heard; Atty. Moeller heard; discussion held on AODA and process; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded
14CV386: Dismissed

14CM386: Count 1: DC
* 30 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. cons. - 2 days credit - Def. to report 7/31/15
* CC
* DNA
Count 2: DC
* 30 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. concurrent
* CC
* DNA

15CF5:
*45 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. - Imposed and Stayed - 3 years PO (37 days credit if revoked)
- AODA & FT
- CC
- DNA

15CF240:
* W/H - 3 years PO
- AODA & FT
- CC
- DNA

15CF248:
*W/H - 3 years PO
- AODA & FT
- CC
- DNA
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with C.L.L., f/w, dob 1/25/70.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

(12:53) Defendant Brian L. Loveland in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (will appoint).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. State moves to amend the complaint verbally - all references to 14CF586 is supposed to be 14CM586; motion granted; Court finds probable cause and orders PH; State heard on bond; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 5/14/15 at 10:00am in Br. 3; Court sets $1,000.00 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with C.L.L., f/w, dob 1/25/70.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
State verbally amends to note that all references to 15CF586 should be 15CM586.
